§ 1341. Interference with functions of Commission(a) Interfering with or influencing the Commission or its employeesIt shall be unlawful for any person (1) to prevent or attempt to prevent, by force, intimidation, threat, or in any other manner, any member or employee of the commission from exercising the functions imposed upon the commission by this subtitle, or (2) to induce, or attempt to induce, by like means any such member or employee to make any decision or order, or to take any action, with respect to any matter within the authority of the commission.
(b) PenaltyAny person who violates any of the provisions of this section shall, upon conviction thereof, be fined not more than $1,000 or imprisonment for not more than one year, or both.
(c) “Person” definedAs used in this section the term “person” includes an individual, corporation, association, partnership, or any other organization or group of individuals.
(June 17, 1930, ch. 497, title III, § 341, 46 Stat. 707.)
